intro: Begonia khaophanomensis, commonly known as the Khaophanom begonia, is a rare and endemic species native to Thailand. It belongs to the Begoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking, velvety foliage with intricate patterns. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often featuring fleshy stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered, and usually come in shades of red or pink, adding to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
